{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-336-04-A
|Item_parent=Non-traumaticoma in adults and children
|Item_parent_short=Non-traumatic coma in adults and children
|Rank=A
|Title=Know how to carry out a neurological examination of a patient in coma.
|Description=Be able to interpret the examination of the pupils, a threatening blink; be able to describe the position and movement of the eyeballs.
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=Nicolas Weiss
|Order=4}}

- Better motor response to nociceptive stimuli

- State of the pupils (photomotor reflex) :

o Myosis >> opioid toxidrome

o Unilateral mydriasis >> temporal engagement until proven otherwise

o Bilateral mydriasis >> tricyclic antidepressant toxidrome or severe neurological impairment

- Eye movements :

o The axis of the 2 eyes is parallel overall (slight exophoria in reality). If this parallelism is lost, suggest a lesion of the brain stem (basilar trunk thrombosis +++, brain stem haematoma).

o Pendular movements of the eyeballs (slow, regular movements from left to right and right to left) are not localising, often associated with coma of intermediate depth.

o Unilateral or bilateral VI paralysis is not localising (length of nerve pathway) >> HTIC

question.title: What is the significance of the pupils' reaction to light in a patient in coma?
question.description: The patient is in a coma and the pupils are examined. What does the reaction to light indicate?

option_a.title: The pupils are dilated, indicating opioid toxidrome
option_a.description: The pupils are dilated, but this is not necessarily indicative of opioid toxidrome

option_b.title: The pupils are constricted, indicating opioid toxidrome
option_b.description: The pupils are constricted, which is a normal response to light

option_c.title: The pupils are dilated bilaterally, indicating tricyclic antidepressant toxidrome
option_c.description: The pupils are dilated bilaterally, but this is not necessarily indicative of tricyclic antidepressant toxidrome

option_d.title: The pupils are constricted unilaterally, indicating unilateral mydriasis
option_d.description: The pupils are constricted unilaterally, which is not a normal response to light
